messages.name: AppMessage
messages.description: AppMessage is the app layer format

fields.name: link
fields.description: TODO: optimize message size

messages.name: Encrypted
messages.description:
Encrypted is a clear structure containing clear and encrypted fields.

We prefer to use a clear struct with encrypted fields instead of a simple
encrypted struct, to improves chances of having a valid structure even
with an invalid passphase. This will force an attacker to have more resources
to test more false-positive guesses.

fields.name: kind
fields.description: kind is a clear representation of the unencrypted link type.

fields.name: nonce
fields.description:
nonce is a clear field used by scrypt as "salt" to derive the passphrase and
also used by cipher.NewCTR as "iv" to initialize a stream cipher.

fields.name: display_name
fields.description: display_name is an optional clear representation of the display name.

fields.name: checksum
fields.description:
checksum is an optional field used to check if the decryption was successful.
the length is customizable (SHAKE256). a longer checksum means less conflicts.
having more conflicts may be bad in term of UX, but make it easier for an attacker
to run an offline bruteforce.

fields.name: group_type
fields.description: clear

fields.name: sent_date
fields.description: specific to outgoing requests

fields.name: passphrase
fields.description: optional passphase to decrypt the link

fields.name: last_update
fields.description: last_update is used to sort conversations, it should be updated for each "visible" event

fields.name: contact_public_key
fields.description: specific to ContactType conversations

fields.name: contact
fields.description: specific to ContactType conversations

fields.name: members
fields.description: specific to MultiMemberType conversations
fields.label: repeated

fields.name: info_date
fields.description: info_date is used when SetGroupInfo is called

fields.name: contacts_to_invite

fields.label: repeated

fields.name: passphrase
fields.description: optional passphase to decrypt the link

fields.name: reset
fields.description: reset will regenerate a new link

fields.name: delay
fields.description: in ms

fields.name: reset
fields.description: reset will regenerate a new link

fields.name: passphrase

fields.name: amount
fields.description: amount Number of entries to be returned. Default is 5.

fields.name: ref_cid
fields.description: ref_cid Reference CID for used for pagination defaulting to oldest/newest depending on sorting. When specified this CID won't be included in the results.

fields.name: conversation_pk
fields.description: conversation_pk Filter by conversation, otherwise X latest message of each conversation are returned

fields.name: oldest_to_newest
fields.description: oldest_to_newest Default sort of results is latest to oldest message

fields.name: no_bulk
fields.description: no_bulk should interactions be via atomic update in the stream

fields.name: passphrase
fields.description: optional passphase to decrypt the link

fields.name: account_pk
fields.description: account_pk is the account public key that owns the device token

fields.name: token_type
fields.description: token_type is the type of the token used, it allows us to act as a proxy to the appropriate push server

fields.description: bundle_id is the app identifier

fields.name: public_key

fields.name: server_key
fields.description: server_key is the push server public key

fields.name: token
fields.description: token is the sealed token of the device

services.name: MessengerService
services.description:
MessengerService is the top-level API that uses the weshnet.protocol to implement the Berty Messenger specific logic.
Today, most of the Berty Messenger logic is implemented directly in the application (see the /js folder of this repo).

methods.name: InstanceShareableBertyID
methods.description: InstanceShareableBertyID returns a Berty ID that can be shared as a string, QR code or deep link.

methods.name: ShareableBertyGroup
methods.description: ShareableBertyGroup returns a Berty Group that can be shared as a string, QR code or deep link.

methods.name: DevShareInstanceBertyID
methods.description:
DevShareInstanceBertyID shares your Berty ID on a dev channel.
TODO: remove for public.

methods.name: DevStreamLogs
methods.description: DevStreamLogs streams logs from the ring-buffer.

methods.name: ParseDeepLink
methods.description:
ParseDeepLink parses a link in the form of berty://xxx or https://berty.tech/id# and returns a structure
that can be used to display information.
This action is read-only.

methods.name: SendContactRequest
methods.description: SendContactRequest takes the payload received from ParseDeepLink and send a contact request using the weshnet.protocol.

methods.name: SystemInfo
methods.description: SystemInfo returns runtime information.

methods.name: EchoTest
methods.description: Use to test stream.

methods.name: EchoDuplexTest
methods.description: Use to test duplex stream.

methods.name: ReplicationServiceRegisterGroup
methods.description: ReplicationServiceRegisterGroup Asks a replication service to distribute a group contents

methods.name: ReplicationSetAutoEnable
methods.description: ReplicationSetAutoEnable Sets whether new groups should be replicated automatically or not

methods.name: BannerQuote
methods.description: BannerQuote returns the quote of the day.

methods.name: InstanceExportData
methods.description: InstanceExportData exports instance data

methods.name: MessageSearch
methods.description: MessageSearch

methods.name: ListMemberDevices
methods.description: ListMemberDevices Lists devices for a member

methods.name: TyberHostSearch
methods.description: TyberHostSearch

methods.name: TyberHostAttach
methods.description: TyberHostAttach

methods.name: DebugAuthServiceSetToken
methods.description: DebugAuthServiceSetToken sets the service token directly without using the PKCE OAuth 2 token issuer

methods.name: ServicesTokenList
methods.description: ServicesTokenList Retrieves the list of service server tokens

methods.name: AuthServiceInitFlow
methods.description: AuthServiceInitFlow Initialize an authentication flow

methods.name: AuthServiceCompleteFlow
methods.description: AuthServiceCompleteFlow Completes an authentication flow

methods.name: PushSetAutoShare
methods.description: PushSetAutoShare Sets whether new groups should receive our push token automatically or not

methods.name: PushShareTokenForConversation
methods.description: PushShareTokenForConversation Share a push token for a conversation

methods.name: PushTokenSharedForConversation
methods.description: PushTokenSharedForConversation

methods.name: PushReceive
methods.description: PushReceive handles a push payload, decrypts it if possible, adds it to the local store

methods.name: PushSend
methods.description: PushSend sends a push payload to a specified list of group members

methods.name: PushSetDeviceToken
methods.description: PushSetDeviceToken registers a push token for the current device

methods.name: PushSetServer
methods.description: PushSetServer registers a push server for the current device

methods.name: DirectoryServiceRegister
methods.description: DirectoryServiceRegister registers a verified credential on a directory service

methods.name: DirectoryServiceUnregister
methods.description: DirectoryServiceUnregister requests a directory service to remove a verified credential

methods.name: DirectoryServiceQuery
methods.description: DirectoryServiceQuery queries a directory service for given identifiers

scalarValueTypes.notes: Uses variable-length encoding. Inefficient for encoding negative numbers  if your field is likely to have negative values, use sint32 instead.
Uses variable-length encoding. Inefficient for encoding negative numbers  if your field is likely to have negative values, use sint64 instead.
Uses variable-length encoding. Signed int value. These more efficiently encode negative numbers than regular int32s.
Uses variable-length encoding. Signed int value. These more efficiently encode negative numbers than regular int64s.
Always four bytes. More efficient than uint32 if values are often greater than 2^28.
Always eight bytes. More efficient than uint64 if values are often greater than 2^56.
A string must always contain UTF-8 encoded or 7-bit ASCII text.
May contain any arbitrary sequence of bytes.
